author: jsdelfino

author: mturyn
msg: 1.) Fixed a bug under IE when there are no rows (a layout method references firstRow.childNodes
without gating against there not being a first row).
2.) Fixed overflow from rightmost header under IE by a.) making the formerly invisible
splitter pane to its right visible, and b.) styling it like a header.  The overflow
never showed before the splitterpane was put in front of it; something's messed up in IE (6&7)
that seems to make {clipped text} + {invisible pane --> {visible text}.
3.) Seem to be close to fixing scrollbar stuff; setHeight() is altered so that:
a.) under Mozilloid browsers, we don't attempt to set the height until
the domNode, scrollDiv, and table all have non-zero heights and widths (seems
not to bother row-less tables, but we'll see).
b.) we reset the scrollDiv over flow to "scroll", size it, then switch it
back to "auto" with a 500ms delay so that it will have time to know
that it's being overflowed (I think).
The "Seem" and "close" to in 3.) sup. are there because I doubt this is everything; still
it looks a lot better than it was earlier tod--- yesterday.

msg: Avoid sending Update messages if there are no properties to be updated
